chunk_metadata.created_by: Enhanced Markdown Chunker with Comprehensive Context

works.Name: Ritmo Vito
works.Notes: Eight-dance suite inspired by Caribbean rhythms; instrumentation variable; suitable for mixed-ability ensembles.
works.Long Description: A tonal, rhythmically driven suite of eight Caribbean-inspired dances that invites players to share a common groove; written for string orchestra with flexible scoring.
works.Short Description: Caribbean-inspired dance suite for string orchestra.

works.Name: Vom Nichts zu nichts
works.Notes: Programmatic snow-storm piece; begins quietly, builds to percussion climax, then fades.
works.Long Description: A tone-poem depicting a snowstorm that starts softly, reaches a percussive climax evoking wind whipping snow from fir trees, and then gradually disappears.
works.Short Description: Snow-storm tone poem for strings and percussion.

works.Name: Symphony No. 3 "Pianto"
works.Notes: Four-movement programmatic symphony; themes of childhood, fear of KGB, ending in ‘crying’.
works.Long Description: A 30-minute programmatic symphony in four movements: Vivo. Nostalgico – Tenuto. Funebre – Agitato – Funebre. After an introduction, a dark movement with lighter childhood motifs is followed by an agitato evoking fear of the KGB, concluding in ‘Pianto’ (Weeping).
works.Short Description: Third symphony for strings, celesta, percussion and organ.

works.Name: Leggenda per la Notte di Natale
works.Notes: Christmas Eve tone-poem depicting the Nativity story.
works.Long Description: A 7-minute tone-poem for string orchestra that places the story of the birth of Jesus at the center of the music, creating an evocative ‘Legend for Christmas Eve’.
works.Short Description: Christmas Nativity tone poem for string orchestra.

works.Name: Dialogo
works.Notes: Conversational work featuring dialogue between two solo violins and string orchestra.
works.Long Description: A 10-minute work demonstrating Capuis’s love of strings. After a slow introduction, two violins converse in a solo passage; the dialogue is taken up and continued by the full string orchestra, ending peacefully as it began.
works.Short Description: Conversational piece for two solo violins and strings.

works.Name: Sinfonietta
works.Notes: Neo-baroque four-movement work for advanced youth or amateur orchestras; prize winner 1993.
works.Long Description: A 20-minute neo-baroque four-movement work (Allegro – Scherzo: Allegro molto – Presto – Adagio – Finale) arranged from the composer’s 1958 String Quartet. Rhythmically lively, contrapuntal, in the spirit of the early 1960s; suitable for conservatory or advanced amateur orchestras. Winner of the Hamelner Jugendmusikschulpreis 1993.

works.Name: Undulations
works.Notes: Commissioned by Castle Toward, Scotland; inspired by Australian beaches and water imagery.
works.Long Description: An 11-minute two-movement work reflecting the composer’s love of water and Australian beaches. I. Adagio – with sensitivity: theme and variations moving from D minor to E Dorian. II. Vigorously: syncopated ostinati and flowing melodic impressions, closing with a varied return of the E Dorian material.

works.Name: Onomatopoeia: Chan Chan
works.Notes: Water-themed work using onomatopoeic material from 24 world languages; premiered in Germany 2023.
works.Long Description: A 12-minute tone-poem for string orchestra whose musical material is derived from the idiomatic translation of the expression ‘Home Sweet Home’ into 24 world languages. Depicts flowing water through glissandi, irregular rhythms and chromatic runs.
works.Short Description: Water-inspired tone poem based on multilingual onomatopoeia.

chunk_info.processing_notes: All complete works with name and composer extracted; durations, publishers, ISMNs and descriptive notes taken directly from the chunk.
